verses.verse: And it came to pass at the end <WH7093> of two full <WH3117> years <WH8141>, that Pharaoh <WH6547> dreamed <WH2492>: and, behold, he stood <WH5975> by the river <WH2975>.
And, behold, there came up <WH5927> out of the river <WH2975> seven <WH7651> well <WH3303> favoured <WH4758> kine <WH6510> and fatfleshed <WH1277> <WH1320>; and they fed <WH7462> in a meadow <WH260>.

And, behold, seven <WH7651> other <WH312> kine <WH6510> came up <WH5927> after them <WH310> out of the river <WH2975>, ill <WH7451> favoured <WH4758> and leanfleshed <WH1851> <WH1320>; and stood <WH5975> by <WH681> the other kine <WH6510> upon the brink <WH8193> of the river <WH2975>.

And the ill <WH7451> favoured <WH4758> and leanfleshed <WH1851> <WH1320> kine <WH6510> did eat up <WH398> the seven <WH7651> well <WH3303> favoured <WH4758> and fat <WH1277> kine <WH6510>. So Pharaoh <WH6547> awoke <WH3364>.

And he slept <WH3462> and dreamed <WH2492> the second time <WH8145>: and, behold, seven <WH7651> ears of corn <WH7641> came up <WH5927> upon one <WH259> stalk <WH7070>, rank <WH1277> and good <WH2896>. rank: Heb. fat
And, behold, seven <WH7651> thin <WH1851> ears <WH7641> and blasted <WH7710> with the east wind <WH6921> sprung up <WH6779> after them <WH310>.

And the seven thin <WH1851> ears <WH7641> devoured <WH1104> the seven <WH7651> rank <WH1277> and full <WH4392> ears <WH7641>. And Pharaoh <WH6547> awoke <WH3364>, and, behold, it was a dream <WH2472>.

And it came to pass in the morning <WH1242> that his spirit <WH7307> was troubled <WH6470>; and he sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> for all the magicians <WH2748> of Egypt <WH4714>, and all the wise men <WH2450> thereof: and Pharaoh <WH6547> told <WH5608> them his dream <WH2472>; but there was none that could interpret <WH6622> them unto Pharaoh <WH6547>.
Then spake <WH1696> the chief <WH8269> butler <WH8248> unto Pharaoh <WH6547>, saying <WH559>, I do remember <WH2142> my faults <WH2399> this day <WH3117>:

Pharaoh <WH6547> was wroth <WH7107> with his servants <WH5650>, and put <WH5414> me in ward <WH4929> in the captain <WH8269> of the guard's <WH2876> house <WH1004>, both me and the chief <WH8269> baker <WH644>:
And we dreamed <WH2492> a dream <WH2472> in one <WH259> night <WH3915>, I and he; we dreamed <WH2492> each man <WH376> according to the interpretation <WH6623> of his dream <WH2472>.

And there was there with us a young man <WH5288>, an Hebrew <WH5680>, servant <WH5650> to the captain <WH8269> of the guard <WH2876>; and we told <WH5608> him, and he interpreted <WH6622> to us our dreams <WH2472>; to each man <WH376> according to his dream <WH2472> he did interpret <WH6622>.
And it came to pass, as he interpreted <WH6622> to us, so it was; me he restored <WH7725> unto mine office <WH3653>, and him he hanged <WH8518>.

Then Pharaoh <WH6547> sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> Joseph <WH3130>, and they brought him hastily <WH7323> out of the dungeon <WH953>: and he shaved <WH1548> himself, and changed <WH2498> his raiment <WH8071>, and came in <WH935> unto Pharaoh <WH6547>. brought: Heb. made him run

And Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> unto Joseph <WH3130>, I have dreamed <WH2492> a dream <WH2472>, and there is none that can interpret <WH6622> it: and I have heard <WH8085> say <WH559> of thee, that thou canst understand <WH8085> a dream <WH2472> to interpret <WH6622> it. thou: or, when thou hearest a dream thou canst interpret it
And Joseph <WH3130> answered <WH6030> Pharaoh <WH6547>, saying <WH559>, It is not in me <WH1107>: God <WH430> shall give <WH6030> Pharaoh <WH6547> an answer <WH6030> of peace <WH7965>.
And Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH1696> unto Joseph <WH3130>, In my dream <WH2472>, behold, I stood <WH5975> upon the bank <WH8193> of the river <WH2975>:

And, behold, there came up <WH5927> out of the river <WH2975> seven <WH7651> kine <WH6510>, fatfleshed <WH1277> <WH1320> and well <WH3303> favoured <WH8389>; and they fed <WH7462> in a meadow <WH260>:

And, behold, seven <WH7651> other <WH312> kine <WH6510> came up <WH5927> after them <WH310>, poor <WH1803> and very <WH3966> ill <WH7451> favoured <WH8389> and leanfleshed <WH7534> <WH1320>, such <WH2007> as I never <WH3808> saw <WH7200> in all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> for badness <WH7455>:
And the lean <WH7534> and the ill favoured <WH7451> kine <WH6510> did eat up <WH398> the first <WH7223> seven <WH7651> fat <WH1277> kine <WH6510>:

And when they had eaten them up <WH935> <WH7130>, it could not be known <WH3045> that they had eaten them <WH935> <WH7130>; but they were still <WH4758> ill favoured <WH7451>, as at the beginning <WH8462>. So I awoke <WH3364>. eaten: Heb. come to the inward parts of them
And I saw <WH7200> in my dream <WH2472>, and, behold, seven <WH7651> ears <WH7641> came up <WH5927> in one <WH259> stalk <WH7070>, full <WH4392> and good <WH2896>:
And, behold, seven <WH7651> ears <WH7641>, withered <WH6798>, thin <WH1851>, and blasted <WH7710> with the east wind <WH6921>, sprung up <WH6779> after them <WH310>: withered: or, small

And the thin <WH1851> ears <WH7641> devoured <WH1104> the seven <WH7651> good <WH2896> ears <WH7641>: and I told <WH559> this unto the magicians <WH2748>; but there was none that could declare <WH5046> it to me.
And Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> unto Pharaoh <WH6547>, The dream <WH2472> of Pharaoh <WH6547> is one <WH259>: God <WH430> hath shewed <WH5046> Pharaoh <WH6547> what he is about to do <WH6213>.

The seven <WH7651> good <WH2896> kine <WH6510> are seven <WH7651> years <WH8141>; and the seven <WH7651> good <WH2896> ears <WH7641> are seven <WH7651> years <WH8141>: the dream <WH2472> is one <WH259>.

And the seven <WH7651> thin <WH7534> and ill favoured <WH7451> kine <WH6510> that came up <WH5927> after them <WH310> are seven <WH7651> years <WH8141>; and the seven <WH7651> empty <WH7386> ears <WH7641> blasted <WH7710> with the east wind <WH6921> shall be seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine <WH7458>.
This is the thing <WH1697> which I have spoken <WH1696> unto Pharaoh <WH6547>: What God <WH430> is about to do <WH6213> he sheweth <WH7200> unto Pharaoh <WH6547>.
Behold, there come <WH935> seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of great <WH1419> plenty <WH7647> throughout all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>:

And there shall arise <WH6965> after them <WH310> seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine <WH7458>; and all the plenty <WH7647> shall be forgotten <WH7911> in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>; and the famine <WH7458> shall consume <WH3615> the land <WH776>;

And the plenty <WH7647> shall not be known <WH3045> in the land <WH776> by reason <WH6440> of that famine <WH7458> following <WH310> <WH3651>; for it shall be very <WH3966> grievous <WH3515>. grievous: Heb. heavy

And for that the dream <WH2472> was doubled <WH8138> unto Pharaoh <WH6547> twice <WH6471>; it is because the thing <WH1697> is established <WH3559> by <WH5973> God <WH430>, and God <WH430> will shortly <WH4116> bring it to pass <WH6213>. established: or, prepared of God
Now therefore let Pharaoh <WH6547> look out <WH7200> a man <WH376> discreet <WH995> and wise <WH2450>, and set <WH7896> him over the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

Let Pharaoh <WH6547> do <WH6213> this, and let him appoint <WH6485> officers <WH6496> over the land <WH776>, and take up the fifth part <WH2567> of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> in the seven <WH7651> plenteous <WH7647> years <WH8141>. officers: or, overseers

And let them gather <WH6908> all the food <WH400> of those good <WH2896> years <WH8141> that come <WH935>, and lay up <WH6651> corn <WH1250> under the hand <WH3027> of Pharaoh <WH6547>, and let them keep <WH8104> food <WH400> in the cities <WH5892>.

And that food <WH400> shall be for store <WH6487> to the land <WH776> against the seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine <WH7458>, which shall be in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>; that the land <WH776> perish <WH3772> not through the famine <WH7458>. perish: Heb. be not cut off
And the thing <WH1697> was good <WH3190> in the eyes <WH5869> of Pharaoh <WH6547>, and in the eyes <WH5869> of all his servants <WH5650>.
And Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> unto his servants <WH5650>, Can we find <WH4672> such a one as this <WH2088> is, a man <WH376> in whom <WH834> the Spirit <WH7307> of God <WH430> is?
And Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> unto Joseph <WH3130>, Forasmuch <WH310> as God <WH430> hath shewed <WH3045> thee all this, there is none so discreet <WH995> and wise <WH2450> as thou art:

Thou shalt be <WH1961> over my house <WH1004>, and according unto thy word <WH6310> shall all my people <WH5971> be ruled <WH5401>: only in the throne <WH3678> will I be greater <WH1431> than thou. be ruled: Heb. be armed, or, kiss
And Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> unto Joseph <WH3130>, See <WH7200>, I have set <WH5414> thee over all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

And Pharaoh <WH6547> took off <WH5493> his ring <WH2885> from his hand <WH3027>, and put <WH5414> it upon Joseph's <WH3130> hand <WH3027>, and arrayed <WH3847> him in vestures <WH899> of fine linen <WH8336>, and put <WH7760> a gold <WH2091> chain <WH7242> about his neck <WH6677>; fine: or, silk

And he made him to ride <WH7392> in the second <WH4932> chariot <WH4818> which he had; and they cried <WH7121> before him <WH6440>, Bow the knee <WH86>: and he made <WH5414> him ruler over all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>. Bow: or, Tender father: Heb. Abrech

And Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> unto Joseph <WH3130>, I am Pharaoh <WH6547>, and without <WH1107> thee shall no man <WH376> lift up <WH7311> his hand <WH3027> or foot <WH7272> in all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

And Pharaoh <WH6547> called <WH7121> Joseph's <WH3130> name <WH8034> Zaphnathpaaneah <WH6847>; and he gave <WH5414> him to wife <WH802> Asenath <WH621> the daughter <WH1323> of Potipherah <WH6319> priest <WH3548> of On <WH204>. And Joseph <WH3130> went out <WH3318> over all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>. Zaphnathpaaneah: which in the Coptic signifies, A revealer of secrets, or, The man to whom secrets are revealed priest: or, prince

And Joseph <WH3130> was thirty <WH7970> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he stood <WH5975> before <WH6440> Pharaoh <WH6547> king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714>. And Joseph <WH3130> went out <WH3318> from the presence <WH6440> of Pharaoh <WH6547>, and went throughout <WH5674> all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.
And in the seven <WH7651> plenteous <WH7647> years <WH8141> the earth <WH776> brought forth <WH6213> by handfuls <WH7062>.

And he gathered up <WH6908> all the food <WH400> of the seven <WH7651> years <WH8141>, which were in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, and laid up <WH5414> the food <WH400> in the cities <WH5892>: the food <WH400> of the field <WH7704>, which was round about <WH5439> every city <WH5892>, laid he up <WH5414> in the same <WH8432>.

And Joseph <WH3130> gathered <WH6651> corn <WH1250> as the sand <WH2344> of the sea <WH3220>, very <WH3966> much <WH7235>, until he left <WH2308> numbering <WH5608>; for it was without <WH369> number <WH4557>.

And unto Joseph <WH3130> were born <WH3205> two <WH8147> sons <WH1121> before the years <WH8141> of famine <WH7458> came <WH935>, which Asenath <WH621> the daughter <WH1323> of Potipherah <WH6319> priest <WH3548> of On <WH204> bare <WH3205> unto him. priest: or, prince

And Joseph <WH3130> called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the firstborn <WH1060> Manasseh <WH4519>: For God <WH430>, said he, hath made me forget <WH5382> all my toil <WH5999>, and all my father's <WH1> house <WH1004>. Manasseh: that is, Forgetting

And the name <WH8034> of the second <WH8145> called <WH7121> he Ephraim <WH669>: For God <WH430> hath caused me to be fruitful <WH6509> in the land <WH776> of my affliction <WH6040>. Ephraim: that is, Fruitful
And the seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of plenteousness <WH7647>, that was in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, were ended <WH3615>.

And the seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of dearth <WH7458> began <WH2490> to come <WH935>, according as Joseph <WH3130> had said <WH559>: and the dearth <WH7458> was in all lands <WH776>; but in all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> there was bread <WH3899>.

And when all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> was famished <WH7456>, the people <WH5971> cried <WH6817> to Pharaoh <WH6547> for bread <WH3899>: and Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> unto all the Egyptians <WH4714>, Go <WH3212> unto Joseph <WH3130>; what he saith <WH559> to you, do <WH6213>.

And the famine <WH7458> was over all the face <WH6440> of the earth <WH776>: And Joseph <WH3130> opened <WH6605> all the storehouses, and sold <WH7666> unto the Egyptians <WH4714>; and the famine <WH7458> waxed sore <WH2388> in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>. all the storehouses: Heb. all wherein was
And all countries <WH776> came <WH935> into Egypt <WH4714> to Joseph <WH3130> for to buy <WH7666> corn; because that the famine <WH7458> was so sore <WH2388> in all lands <WH776>.
